ygData.subject: Re: crawl instance stopped crawling
ygData.msgSnippet: Gordon, There wasn t any errors in the logs other than a few INFO and WARNINGS. It just seemed to stop suddenly.  I got impatient and I killed and restarted

From: David Pane <dpane@...>
Subject: Re: crawl instance stopped crawling
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=500983475; y=QAO05kEUsTHrzqvIbRnFcudiLsQI2I65bICv4jcs7ctjy5J6_Uss2w
X-Yahoo-Profile: david_pane1

Gordon,

There wasn't any errors in the logs other than a few INFO and WARNINGS. 
  It just seemed to stop suddenly.  I got impatient and I killed and 
restarted the instance from the last checkpoint, before you responded. 
I couldn't pause the job or create a checkpoint so I forced the crawler 
to stop.

When I recovered from the checkpoint (which took over 1 hr) the crawl 
started up normally, but after about 20 minutes of crawling the web 
interface became unresponsive.  I couldn't get anything but the first 
line on the job page. (no pause, checkpoint terminate buttons or any Job 
is Active reporting.)  The crawl did not seem to be ative based on the 
network activity so I killed that it again and am restarting now.



--David

This time, though, I got many errors similar to this in the logs:

On 1/17/2012 1:17 PM, Gordon Mohr wrote:
> What does the stack for ToeThread #527 show (either via the web UI or
> the 'jstack' tool)?
>
> Were there any other errors noted in the logs, especially around the
> time progress stopped?
>
> Some unrecoverable errors kill a thread without releasing any locks the
> thread holds; that could explain this state. Finding the triggering
> error could help determine how best to resume and if there are any other
> continuing risks on that node.
>
> - Gordon
>
> On 1/17/12 7:33 AM, David Pane wrote:
>> Can someone explain what is happening here and how I can get out of this
>> state. It turns out that the last URI that this instance crawled was
>> yesterday year morning.
>>
>> It appears that every thread has this same Blocked/Waiting On:
>> org.archive.bdb.BdbModule$1@106ac860 which is owned by ToeThread #527:
